chargeHist.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.execSummary:
The defendant Laron A. Batey was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Laron A. Batey is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Laron A. Batey was found guilty of Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Laron A. Batey

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Laron A. Batey in court with attorney Peter Middleton.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee states that the matter is resolved.  Atty Hendee moves to amend Ct. 1 to Misd. Possession of THC.  Ct. 2 to be dismissed. Atty Hendee files a stipulation regarding the seized money.  Atty Middleton agrees.  Defendant agrees.
BY THE COURT:  Ct. 1 will be amended to Misd. Possession of THC.

Defendant enters a No Contest plea.    Court questions defendant regarding plea. Advises of Constitutional Rights and elements of the charge.  Court finds plea made knowingly, voluntarily & Intelligently.

  BY THE COURT:  Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.  Court accepts defendant's plea and finds defendant guilty of the amended Ct. 1.  Ct. 2 to be dismissed.

Atty Hendee asks the court to follow the joint recommendation.
Atty Middleton asks the court to follow the recommendation.

BY THE COURT:  Amended Ct. 1:  Court orders 5 days in the Marquette County Jail
Credit = 5 days
Time Served
Pay fine and costs = $442.00
Bond to be applied; balance to be returned to the party that posted it
Ct. 2 to be dismissed.

**Court signs the stipulation regarding the money seized of $5,828.00.

Attorney Mark J. Gumz in court.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee states that both parties are almost at resolution.  Atty Gumz agrees and asks that this be reset to give a little more time for resolution.

BY THE COURT:  Reset.
bond continued.  Arraignment scheduled for January 21, 2015 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Laron A. Batey in court with attorney Mark J. Gumz.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Gumz states that the defendant will waive his right to a Prelim today and asks that an arraignment date be set.  Court questions the defendant.  Defendant agrees and will waive the Prelim.
  
BY THE COURT:  Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and this defendant committed it.  Case bound over for trial or further proceedings.

Atty Hendee files the information with the court.
  Defendant received a copy of the information & waives it's reading.  
BY THE COURT:  Set for Arraignment.
bond continued.  Arraignment scheduled for November 12, 2014 at 10:15 am.
Probable Cause Affidavit and Judicial Determination
Preliminary hearing on October 20, 2014 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Laron A. Batey in court with attorney Mark J. Gumz appearing by telephone.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Gumz states that he has received a copy of the complaint electronically.
  Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint & waives it's reading.  Atty Hendee requests a $500 cash bond.  Atty Gumz responds and requests a signature bond.

BY THE COURT:  Court sets a $500 cash bond; no conditions.

Atty Gumz states that the defendant will waive the time limits for the Prelim.
BY THE COURT: Time limits waived; set for Prelim.
  Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 20, 2014 at 11:00 am.
